title: LLVM Error with "+soft-float": "Do not know how to split the result of this operator"

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-target-feature
labels.description: Area: Enabling/disabling target features like AVX, Neon, etc.

body:
I can't compile the [`fontdue`-crate](https://github.com/mooman219/fontdue/issues/98) because it fails with: `LLVM ERROR: Do not know how to split this operator's operand!`

I compile it with: `cargo rustc -- -C target-feature=+soft-float,-sse,-sse2,-x87 --emit=llvm-ir`

This happens **with different compiler versions**, independent of **stable or nightly** versions. I tested to build the dependencies of `fontdue` without problems, therefore I think Rustc/LLVM runs into a bug because of the code from `fontdue`.

### LLVM IR
The two LLVM IR files I found after the build can be found [on Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1XgAa_X4HW22Ah_rOAP0DOludk-hqb9Tn?usp=sharing).
